info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 6:36AM CDT until July 26 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following counties, Clay, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper and Richland. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the heaviest amounts over northern Clay and southwest Effingham Counties. The Clay County sheriff reported several areas of the county with water across roadways. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olney, Flora, Newton, Altamont, Louisville, Clay City, Watson, Noble, Dieterich, Edgewood, Xenia, Bible Grove, Ste. Marie, Willow Hill, Parkersburg, Claremont, Calhoun, Wheeler, Iola and Sailor Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
